description: [Status: stable] [Name: missing-type-function-argument] [Message: Missing type annotation for function argument {name}] What it does Checks that function arguments have type annotations. Why is this bad? Type annotations are a good way to document the types of function arguments. They also help catch bugs, when used alongside a type checker, by ensuring that the types of any provided arguments match expectation. Example def foo(x): ... Use instead: def foo(x: int): ...

lint.flake8-annotations.suppress-dummy-a.option_description:
Whether to suppress ANN000-level violations for arguments matching the
"dummy" variable regex (like _).



Example usage:

pyproject.tomlruff.toml


[tool.ruff.lint.flake8-annotations]
suppress-dummy-args = true



[lint.flake8-annotations]
suppress-dummy-args = true
